data.text: @TehRedemptionO @williamchuang @Medscape Gangster move… Try to get him to point to evidence that suggests long-term side effects when the virus has only been around for two years lol.  He’s gonna be chasing his tail trying to knit up long-term evidence when it’s a short term virus.
@williamchuang @TehRedemptionO @Medscape We now know the vaccine does….

@williamchuang @HarleyRider446 @Medscape And could you show me a single study that shows me that the vaccine helps against long term consequences? We're at the point where the medical consensus tells us that it protects against heavy sickness and death, there's zero reason to believe it would cpunter long term effects
@TehRedemptionO @HarleyRider446 @Medscape Because we all know that COVID has no side effects or long-term consequences aside from death.
@TehRedemptionO @MattAHay @williamchuang @Medscape 1 in a 1000? Do you even math bro?

@JohnBoudet @MattAHay @williamchuang @Medscape Boomer telling us its okay that Pharma peddles a drug with a 1 in 1000 chance of severe problems to fight a disease with a 1 in 100000 chance of severe problems for non-obese monstrosities.

How does the boot taste John?

@williamchuang @HarleyRider446 @Medscape Ah ye that explains the dozens of athletes who randomly collapsed in the last year. 

And sidenote buddy: it's usually the unhealthy and old dying, that's how it works, don't need a vaccine to get to that conclusion

@errrinrae @dakroot @ALIASAmendment2 @Medscape Because this is the context that puts your outrageous 400.000 claim into perspective and shows it was unhealthy, old and fat people dying from a cold because they were unhealthy, not because "scary virus"

@RealSteveCox @shoe0nhead @Medscape Steve, stop trying to do your own research, let the badass scientists do that for you and just listen to the headlines like you did for the last 2 years. 

Don't start reading into things now after we told you to for the last two years.
